The Spence ([[Atlanta, Georgia|Atlanta]]) (opening fall 2012) | television = ''[[Top Chef]]''; ''[[Iron Chef America]]'' | prevrests = | awards = | website = http://www.richardblais.net }} '''Richard Blais''' (born February 19, 1972 in [[Uniondale, New York]]) is an [[United States|American]] chef. He currently resides with his wife Jazmin in [[Atlanta|Atlanta, Georgia]], and has two children, Riley Maddox and Embry Lotus. He received an [[Associate's degree|AOS]] in [[culinary art]]s from [[The Culinary Institute of America]] and has studied under chefs [[Thomas Keller]], [[Daniel Boulud]], and [[Ferran Adria]]. Blais has also studied in numerous famed restaurants, including Chez Panisse. He has been profiled in many publications, including ''[[Sports Illustrated]]'', ''[[The New York Times]]'', and ''[[Food & Wine Magazine]]''. His cooking is known for its innovative and personal take on classical cuisine, incorporating global ingredients, modern cooking methods, and a sense of humor.{{cite web| url =http://www.bravotv.com/top-chef/bio/richard-blais| title = Bravo TV Top Chef Bio| author = BravoTV.com}} While using modern techniques in his cooking, Blais believes they should only complement good food: "Hopefully, [[molecular gastronomy]] is an extension of great simple ingredients, not a replacement for them."{{cite web| url =http://www.foodandwine.com/articles/interview-richard-blais| title = Food & Wine Interview| author = Food and Wine Magazine}} Beginning in 2001, Mr. Blais opened BLAIS restaurant to critical national acclaim. In 2005, he led One Midtown Kitchen and helped them receive a four-star review in ''[[The Atlanta Journal-Constitution]]''.{{cite web| url = http://www.accessatlanta.com/restaurants/content/restaurants/reviews/stories/2008/06/24/home_restaurant_atlanta_blais_top_chef.html| title = Richard Blais| author= Access Atlanta}} His company TrailBlais is a partner in a modern hamburger restaurant called 'Flip'.{{cite web|url=http://www.flipburgerboutique.com/ |title=Flip burger boutique |publisher=Flip burger boutique |date= |accessdate=2010-09-21}} Blais is also doing corporate innovation work and product endorsement for companies like [[Diageo]] and Garrett Popcorn. Blais was the winner of the television cooking competition ''[[Top Chef (season 8)|Top Chef: All-Stars]]'' and the runner-up of the fourth season of ''[[Top Chef]]''. ==Top Chef== [[File:Richard Blais.JPG|thumb|right|Richard Blais]] Blais appeared as a contestant on the fourth season of [[Bravo (US TV channel)|Bravo]]'s ''[[Top Chef (season 4)|Top Chef]]''.{{cite web| url = http://www.bravotv.com/Top_Chef/season/4/bios/index.php?cat=chef&p=richard| title = Season 4 Bios: Richard Blais|author= Bravotv.com}} He went on to become the runner-up of ''Top Chef'' losing to [[Stephanie Izard]]. After the completion of ''Top Chef'' Season 4, Blais continued to do work for the show in the form of promotion and blogging. Blais teamed up with fellow season 4 contestant Andrew D'Ambrosi for a cooking demonstration in [[Union Square (New York City)|Union Square]] aboard the ''Top Chef'' Bus.{{cite web| url = http://www.bravotv.com/Top_Chef/season/5/photos/gallery.php?e=the_tour| title = The Tour| author = Bravotv.com}} In addition, Blais blogs on Bravotv.com regarding [[Top Chef (season 5)|the show's 5th season]] {{cite web| url = http://www.bravotv.com/Top_Chef/season/5/blogs/index.php?blog=richard_blais_1| title = Richard Blais's Blog| author = Bravotv.com}} Blais also appeared in the final challenge of the show's fifth season, serving as the sous chef for eventual winner [[Hosea Rosenberg]]. In August 2009, Blais appeared on Bravo's spin off, ''[[Top Chef Masters]]'', working with eventual winner [[Rick Bayless]]. Blais appears on an episode of ''Iron Chef America'' (Battle Chickpea) with ''Top Chef: Las Vegas'' contestant Eli Kirshtein as his sous chef. Along with this, he makes an appearance on the same show as ''Iron Chef America'' [[Cat Cora]]'s sous chef on Battles Ricotta, Grapes, and Oatmeal. In 2010, Blais competed in ''[[Top Chef (season 8)|Top Chef: All-Stars]]''. He won the competition, earning the title of Top Chef by defeating Mike Isabella in the season finale, which aired on March 30, 2011. In July 2011, Blais had signed a cook book deal with Clarkson Potter, a division of Random House. The book will be published in the fall of 2012. In November 2011, Richard ran the ING New York City marathon for Alliance for a Healthier Generation. His first marathon, Blais finished the race at 4:31:54 pushing through the last five miles struggling with leg cramping. ==''Blais Off''== As of December 17, 2010, Blais hosts a new show, ''Blais Off'', on The [[Science Channel]]. According to promotional materials, he uses his scientific cooking techniques to reinvent classic foods and "takes his experiments on the road, visiting some of the most popular eateries in America."{{cite web|url=http://science.discovery.com/tv/blais-off/ |title=Sneak Peeks: Blais Off |author=The Science Channel |accessdate=12 December 2010}} ==Restaurants== *'''Flip burger boutique''' is described as fine dining between two buns. The restaurant can be found in three locations; two are in [[Atlanta, Georgia|Atlanta]] and one is in [[Birmingham, Alabama|Birmingham]]. {{cite web|url=http://www.flipburgerboutique.com/ |title=Flip burger boutique |accessdate=11 August 2011}} *'''HD-1''' aka Haute Doggery is a gourmet hot dog restaurant in the Poncey-Highlands neighborhood of Atlanta {{cite web|url=http://www.savoryexposure.com/2011/09/hd1-by-richard-blais/ |title=HD1}} *'''The Spence''' is a joint venture with Concentrics Restaurants and is expected to open in [[Atlanta, Georgia|Atlanta]] in the fall of 2012.{{cite web|url=http://atlanta.eater.com/archives/2011/08/10/richard-blais-announces-the-name-of-his-new-concept-the-spence.php |title=Chef Richard Blais Reveals New Restaurant Name: The Spence |author=Jennifer Zyman |accessdate=11 August 2011}} ==References== {{reflist}} ==Resources== *[http://www.richardblais.net/ Richard Blais official site] *[http://www.trailblais.com/ Richard Blais' company] *[http://www.bravotv.com/top-chef/bio/richard-blais Bravo TV biography] *[http://www.foodandwine.com/articles/interview-richard-blais Food & Wine interview] *[http://online.wsj.com/public/article/SB112674684283541340-u4lrpQPQ4y6WIhZw0JnXhdUo3e0_20051017.html Chefs Gone Wild] *[http://www.sousvidesupreme.com/ Sous Vide Supreme, a Richard Blais endorsed product] {{Navbox Top Chef}} {{Persondata | NAME = Blais, Richard | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = | DATE OF BIRTH = February 19, 1972 | PLACE OF BIRTH = [[Uniondale, New York|Uniondale]], [[New York]], [[United States]] | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Blais, Richard}} [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:1972 births]] [[Category:American chefs]] [[Category:People from New York]] [[Category:Participants in American reality television series]] [[Category:Top Chef contestants]]
